titleInfo.title: Brown v. Brody et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - Plaintiff is directed to correct the above-listed technical defect in the Complaint on or before January 3, 2012. Failure to comply with this Memorandum and Order will result in dismissal of this matter without further notice. The Clerk of the court is directed to set a pro se case management deadline in this matter with the following text: January 3, 2012: deadline for payment or filing of IFP application. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (Copy mailed as directed with forms to pro se party) (AOA)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 4:11-cv-03217; Brown v. Brody et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - Plaintiff is directed to correct the above-listed technical defect in the Complaint on or before January 3, 2012. Failure to comply with this Memorandum and Order will result in dismissal of this matter without further notice. The Clerk of the court is directed to set a pro se case management deadline in this matter with the following text: January 3, 2012: deadline for payment or filing of IFP application. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (Copy mailed as directed with forms to pro se party) (AOA)

titleInfo.title: Brown v. Brody et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - Plaintiff's Motion for Leave to Proceed In Forma Pauperis (filing no. 5) is granted. Plaintiff shall pay an initial partial filing fee of $8.04 by January 20, 2012, unless an enlargement of time is granted in response to a written motion. The Clerk of the court is directed to send a copy of this order to the appropriate official at Plaintiff's institution and set a pro se case management deadline in this case using the following text: January 20, 2012: initial partial filing fee payment due. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (Copies mailed as directed and to pro se party)(AOA)

titleInfo.title: Brown v. Brody et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - Plaintiff's Complaint (filing no. 1) is dismissed without prejudice. A separate judgment will be entered in accordance with this Memorandum and Order. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (Copy mailed to pro se party) (AOA)

titleInfo.title: Brown v. Brody et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - Plaintiff's Motion for Reconsideration (filing no. 10) is denied. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (Copy mailed to pro se party) (AOA)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 4:11-cv-03217; Brown v. Brody et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - Plaintiff's Motion for Reconsideration (filing no. 10) is denied. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (Copy mailed to pro se party) (AOA)

titleInfo.title: Brown v. Brody et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - Plaintiff is permitted leave to appeal in forma pauperis. Plaintiff shall pay an initial partial filing fee of $8.04 by March 27, 2012, unless an enlargement of time is granted in response to a written motion. After payment of the initial partial filing fee, Plaintiffs institution shall collect the additional monthly payments in the manner set forth in 28 U.S.C. ยง 1915(b)(2), quoted above, and shall forward those installments to the court. The Clerk of the court is directed to send a copy of this order to the appropriate official at Plaintiff's institution and to the Eighth Circuit Court of Appeals. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (Copy mailed to pro se party and as directed)(AOA)

titleInfo.title: Brown v. Brody et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - Plaintiffs Motion for Reconsideration (filing no. 22), liberally construed as a Motion for Relief Under Rule 60(b), is denied. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (Copy mailed to pro se party) (AOA)
